DOC.brief_summary: Physiotherapy offers a range of therapeutic modalities for pain management including Transcutaneous Electrical Nerve Stimulation (TENS), Interferential current (IC) and Acupuncture. The objective of this study was to investigate the hypoalgesic effect of TENS, CI and Acupuncture in a cold-induced pain model.
DOC.brief_title: Comparison of the Analgesic Effects of Acupuncture and Modulated Electroanalgesia in Cold Induced Pain
DOC.criteria: Healthy subjects Subjects with no history of any kind of disease
